intro: Lepidadenia tephrophylla, commonly known as the silky-leaved tephrophylla, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, often appearing in late spring or early summer. Its roots are known to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Lepidadenia tephrophylla is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
